column2: MICHIGAN DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Michigan

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Drivers under 21 years of age are considered to be driving under the influence if their blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is:
column4: .08% or higher.
column8: .10% or higher.

column2: 2. This sign means:
column4: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
column6: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 3. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
column8: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column10: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.

column2: 4. When approaching a curve, remember to:
column4: drive at the posted speed limit throughout the curve.
column6: accelerate slightly before entering the curve.
column8: slow down before entering the curve.
column10: drive at the posted speed limit as you enter the curve, then slow down gradually.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: Low clearance
column8: All traffic turn right

column2: 6. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: increase your speed and move to the left.
column6: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column8: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.
column10: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.

column2: 7. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
column4: Pentagon
column8: Diamond

column2: 8. Your BAC depends on:
column4: the type of beverage you drink.
column8: the amount of alcohol you drink.

column2: 9. This sign means:
column4: Divided highway ahead.
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: Steep downgrade
column8: Narrow Bridge

column2: 11. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column4: It improves the vehicle stability.
column6: It helps increase your stopping distance.
column8: It improves the steering ability.

column2: 12. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: the type of route you are on.
column6: the speed limit on that route.
column8: how many miles are left before you reach your destination.
column10: that the route you are on might be dangerous.

column2: 13. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must turn into its left lane.
column6: must turn into its right lane.
column8: must go to the next intersection.

column2: 14. Your brake lights tell other drivers that you:
column4: are slowing down or stopping.
column8: are making a turn.

column2: 15. When changing lanes, you should not:
column4: use the inside rearview mirror to check for blind spots
column6: check your side and rear view mirrors.
column8: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.

column2: 16. When you see this sign you should:
column4: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column6: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column8: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column10: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.

column2: 17. This sign means:
column4: The traffic signal ahead is out of order
column8: you must yield to the traffic signal ahead.

column2: 18. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column4: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.
column8: must enter the roadway immediately.
column10: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.

column2: 19. When driving on slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: avoid crossing bridges or intersections.
column8: change lanes quickly.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: Side road
column8: School zone ahead

column2: 21. If another car is in danger of hitting you, you should:
column4: use your emergency lights.
column8: sound your horn.

column2: 22. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column4: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.
column8: keep more space in front of their vehicle.
column10: keep less space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 23. Drivers who eat and drink while driving:
column4: may have trouble controlling their vehicles.
column8: have no driving errors.

column2: 24. You should increase your following distance when:
column4: driving behind a large vehicle that blocks your vision.
column8: exiting a freeway.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column4: Sharp curves ahead
column8: Merging traffic from the right

column2: 26. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column4: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.
column8: cross the tracks.

column2: 27. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is an intersection ahead.
column6: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column8: right turns are not allowed.
column10: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 28. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: must make a U-turn and then turn right.
column6: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column8: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column10: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.

column2: 29. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column4: aggressive driving.
column8: closetailing.

column2: 30. You can pass on the right:
column4: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
column6: when passing is restricted by parked cars.
column8: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.
column10: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.

column2: 31. This road sign means:
column4: Mountain trail
column8: Pedestrian crossing

column2: 32. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
column4: one hour.
column8: 3 hours.

column2: 33. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
column6: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column8: How fit you are. How much alcohol you drink. Your height.
column10: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.

column2: 34. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: No one.
column8: Both.

column2: 35. This road sign means:
column4: No Bicycle zone
column8: Bicycle repair shop ahead

column2: 36. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Get out of the car and check behind the car.
column8: Look through your back window for children.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
column4: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.
column8: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.
column10: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.

column2: 38. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
column4: blue; white
column8: green; white

column2: 39. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs:
column4: reduces the effects of the drug or medicine.
column6: reduces the effects of the alcohol.
column8: has no effect, they are different substances.
column10: could multiply the effects of the alcohol.

column2: 40. When you reach an intersection with a stop sign, you should:
column4: follow the vehicle ahead of you.
column6: stop, look right, then left, then right again.
column8: stop, look left, then right, then left again.
column10: check your rearview mirror, look left, then right, then proceed.

column2: 41. This warning sign:
column4: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column6: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column8: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column10: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.

column2: 42. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
column6: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.
column8: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column10: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.

column2: 43. Your blind spot is the area of the road:
column4: you cannot see without moving your head.
column6: you see in your side mirror.
column8: you see in your rearview mirror.

column2: 44. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: move to the center of the lane on steel deck bridges.
column6: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.
column8: quickly change speed or lane position.

column2: 45. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: chasing or challenging other drivers.
column8: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.
column10: quick lane changes without a signal.

column2: 46. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic
column8: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles

column2: 47. Vehicle stopping distance never depends on:
column4: the condition of your vehicle's brakes.
column6: the condition and type of vehicle tires.
column8: your own reaction time.

column2: 48. This road sign means:
column4: Keep right
column8: No right turn

column2: 49. Drivers may continue carefully through a yellow light if:
column4: they already are within the intersection.
column8: an emergency vehicle is crossing your lane.

column2: 50. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column4: emergency flashers.
column8: low beam headlights.
